授業目的: 本授業の目的は、国際的に活躍する公認会計士(CPA)や公認管理会計士(CMA)、大手金融機関の管理職、グローバルな事業法人の財務管理者や会計･財務担当役員、CFO等の会計･財務プロフェッショナルを目指す者に不可欠な素養である英語でコーポレート･ファイナンス（財務管理／経営財務）をコミュニケートし使いこなすための基礎的な知識と技能を効率的かつ効果的に習得することである。
到達目標: 本授業は、公認会計士(CPA)や公認管理会計士(CMA)、大手金融機関の管理職、グローバルな事業法人の財務管理者や財務担当役員、CFO等の会計･財務プロフェッショナルを目指す学生が、ポートフォリオ理論や投資・資金調達・ペイアウトの意思決定に関する理論、企業価値を評価するためのアプローチ等のコーポレート･ファイナンス（財務管理／経営財務）の主要テーマを英語で説明･活用できるようになることを到達目標にしている。
関連科目: Students are expected to be familiar with introductory finance in Japanese and/or basic managerial accounting in English.
授業の概要・背景: For the aim of enabling students to engage in corporate financial management in English, this course provides a rigorous introduction to corporate finance/financial management with attention to challenges arising in the private sector, through a flexible class format.
授業方法: For the convenience of double-school students and part-time students who are full-time employees in the private/public sector, the 2025 class will be conducted as a "Hiflex" lesson so that students can choose to attend either face-to-face or online.  The course employs lecture-discussions.  Several classes may be devoted to exercises.  Midterm "tale-home" exam and final "open-book/on-line" examination will be assigned.

第1回: Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第2回:
Interest rates:
Determinants of interest rates, term structure of interest rates, duration
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第3回:
Risk measurement:
Definition of risk, specific types of risk, effects of diversification
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第4回:
Portfolio management:
Expected return, variability of portfolio's return, efficient frontier, optimal portfolios
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第5回:
Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM):
Risk premium, Beta coefficient, security market line (SML), Arbitrage Pricing Theory (APT)
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第6回:
Long-term capital financing:
Types of stocks, types of bonds, capital structure, perfect market, the "MM" theories
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第7回:
Optimal capitalization:
Cost of capital, Weighted-Average Cost of Capital (WACC), opimal capital structure
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第8回:
Leverage:
Operating leverage, financial leverage, total leverage, business risk vs. financial risk
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第9回:
Capital budgeting:
Marginal cost of capital, marginal efficiency of investment, capital budgeting techniques
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第10回:
Investment analyses:
independent projects, mutually-exclusive projects, decisions under capital rationing
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第11回:
Payout policy:
Dividend vs. stock repurchase, types of dividends, signaling hypothesis, clientele effect
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第12回:
Financial derivatives:
Means of hedging, futures contracts, forward agreements, swaps, options
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第13回:
Valuation:
Accounting model vs. economic model, FCF approach, EVA approach
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
第14回:
Business combinations and restructurings:
Mergers and acquisitions,reasons for business combinations, Market Value Added (MVA)
Preparation and/or review may take an average student approximately 4 hours per week.
